title: Brexit votes in the United Kingdom by social class 2016
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Remain, and Leave. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 2 groups, Leave had the highest Share of respondents in Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and Remain had the lowest Share of respondents in Response Lower Working-Class (DE).
Among all the Responses, Leave had the highest Share of respondents in Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and lowest Share of respondents in Response Upper Middle-Class (AB).
Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and Upper Middle-Class (AB) had the biggest gap of 21.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Leave.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Remain, and Leave. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.

Response Upper Working-Class (C2) had the maximum Share of respondents among all 2 groups, and it was for Leave. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Response Lower Working-Class (DE) for Remain.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Remain, and Leave. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 2 groups, Leave had the highest Share of respondents in Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and Remain had the lowest Share of respondents in Response Lower Working-Class (DE).
Among all the Responses, Leave had the highest Share of respondents in Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and lowest Share of respondents in Response Upper Middle-Class (AB).
Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and Upper Middle-Class (AB) had the biggest gap of 21.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Leave.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Remain, and Leave. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Upper Working-Class (C2), Leave had the highest Share of respondents 64.0 among the 2 groups and in Lower Working-Class (DE), Remain had the lowest Share of respondents 36.0.
Among all the Responses, Leave had the highest Share of respondents in Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and lowest Share of respondents in Response Upper Middle-Class (AB).
Response Upper Working-Class (C2) and Upper Middle-Class (AB) had the biggest gap of 21.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Leave.
Among the groups, Remain had the biggest difference in Share of respondents. Where the maximum Share of respondents was 1.58 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents.
On average, the Response Upper Middle-Class (AB) had the highest Share of respondents for all 2 groups Remain, and Leave. Whereas Lower Working-Class (DE) had the lowest average Share of respondents.
